brief_summary.textblock:
The study is designed to confirm safety and efficacy of the SD01 ICD (implantable
      cardioverter-defibrillator) lead.

clinical_study.brief_title: SD01 Master Study (Safety and Efficacy Study)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Standard indication for an ICD/CRT-D therapy

          -  Signed informed consent form

          -  Patient is willing and able to participate for the whole study duration

          -  Patient is willing and able to activate and use the CardioMessenger

          -  Legal capacity and ability to consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Standard contraindication for an ICD/CRT-D therapy

          -  Age <18 years.

          -  Pregnant or breastfeeding

          -  Cardiac surgery is planned within the next six months

          -  Any condition that in the opinion of the investigator would preclude compliance with
             the study protocol during the whole follow-up period

          -  Enrollment in another cardiac clinical investigation with active treatment arm

          -  Mechanical tricuspid valve prosthesis or severe tricuspid valve disease

          -  Dexamethasone acetate intolerance

study_pop.textblock:
Patients with standard ICD/CRT-D (cardiac resynchronization therapy plus defibrillator)
        indication

clinical_study.official_title: SD01 Master Study (Safety and Efficacy Study)

overall_official.affiliation: University Clinic of Schleswig-Holstein, Lübeck, Germany

authority: Hungary: Office of Health Authorisation and Administrative Procedures
France: French medicines and healthcare products safety agency

primary_outcome.description: The evaluation of right ventricular sensing performance is based on the assessment of consecutive intrinsic beats documented with markers on an IEGM (intra-cardiac electrogram). The evaluation of ventricular sensing performance is based on the data to be collected during the 3-month follow-up. The appropriate pacing performance in the right ventricle results from the evaluation of "capture" at the end of the 3-month follow-up.
primary_outcome.measure: Rate of appropriate sensing and pacing
Serious adverse device effects (SADEs) related to the SD01 lead

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the manually measured pacing threshold of the SD01 lead system to the Linox SD lead at 3-month follow-up. The idea is that the pacing threshold will be similar within a suitable range.
secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of pacing threshold between Linoxsmart and SD01
Shift rate of the painless shock impedance measurement

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
